title: Cargo ship hit by missile in Gulf of Aden in suspected attack by Yemen Houthi rebels . No one hurt
message:
MANAMA, Bahrain (AP) — A missile attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels hit an Antigua- and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship in the Gulf of Aden, the latest assault on shipping in the region.
The British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center similarly reported the attack and fire in the same area off Aden, saying “damage control is underway."
Gen. Yahya Saree claimed the attack in a prerecorded video message Sunday, saying the vessel had been targeted with both missiles and drones.
He identified the vessel as the Norderney, a ship that tracking data analyzed by The Associated Press showed was still in the Gulf of Aden on Sunday afternoon.
The Houthis have launched more than 50 attacks on shipping, killed three sailors, seized one vessel and sunk another since November, according to the U.S. Maritime Administration.

title: Israeli Airstrike Kills Two In Lebanon
message:
(MENAFN- Gulf Times) Two people were killed on Saturday in an Israeli on the outskirts of the southern Lebanese town of Aitaroun, Lebanon's state news agency NNA said.
The Israeli military said in a statement that its had identified a Hezbollah fighter in the Aitaroun area, and that soon afterwards an Israeli aircraft had carried out an airstrike that hit the individual.
Israeli forces launched two missiles targeting a cafe at a station, causing significant damage to the premises and to the surrounding area, NNA said.
A security source told Reuters it was the first time the group used that model of rockets, having used the Falaq 1 previously.
Israel Defence Forces (IDF)“identified a Hezbollah fighter in the area of Aitaroun in southern Lebanon, and shortly afterward an IAF aircraft struck the fighter,” the Israeli military said in a statement.

title: Cargo ship hit by missile in Gulf of Aden in suspected attack by Yemen Houthi rebels . No one hurt
message:
Dubai, Jun 9 (AP) A missile struck an Antigua and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship in the Gulf of Aden on Sunday in a suspected attack by Houthi rebels in Yemen, authorities said.
The missile hit the ship's forward station, starting a fire that those on board later put out, the private security firm Ambrey said.
A second missile fired at the ship missed and people “on board small boats in the vicinity opened fire on the ship during the incident,” Ambrey added, though no one was hurt onboard.
The British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center similarly reported an attack late Saturday in the same area off Aden, but provided no further details.
The rebels did not immediately claim the assault, though it can sometimes take hours or even days for them to acknowledge their attacks.

Target event:
A missile hit an Antigua and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship in the Gulf of Aden on Sunday in a suspected attack by Houthi rebels in Yemen, authorities said.

title: 4 killed , 5 injured in Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon
message:
Four people, including two Hezbollah members, were killed, and five others were injured in Israeli airstrikes on villages in southern Lebanon, Lebanese military sources told the media.
The sources, who spoke anonymously, said on Saturday that an Israeli warplane targeted a house in the village of Houla, killing two Hezbollah members and injuring three civilians, Xinhua news agency reported.
The sources added that another Israeli airstrike targeted, with two air-to-surface missiles, a commercial market in the village of Aitaroun, killing two civilians and wounding two others.
Tensions increased between Hezbollah and the Israeli army in the wake of the latter’s announcement of completing deployment for a major offensive against the former.
Israel then retaliated by firing heavy artillery toward southeastern Lebanon.

title: Two killed , fires rage in Lebanon after Israeli strikes - Newspaper
message:
BEIRUT: Israeli strikes on Saturday killed two people and sparked wildfires in southern Lebanon, state media said, with Hezbollah announcing the death of one fighter.
Hezbollah, a Hamas ally, has traded near-daily fire with Israeli forces in the eight months since the Gaza conflict began, triggered by Hamas’ October 7 raid.
The deadly clashes have intensified in recent weeks, causing multiple brush fires on both sides of the Israel-Lebanon border.
The movement later announced that one of its fighters was killed by Israeli fire.
More than eight months of border violence, which began on October 8, has killed 458 people in Leba­non, mostly fighters but including about 90 civilians, according to a tally.

title: Hezbollah launches drone strike against Israeli artillery position in Shebaa Farms
message:
Hezbollah launches drone strike against Israeli artillery position in Shebaa FarmsIran Press TVSaturday, 08 June 2024 10:20 AMFighters from Lebanon's Hezbollah resistance movement have launched a retaliatory drone strike against an Israeli artillery position in the occupied Shebaa Farms in response to the regime's ongoing war on Gaza.
Earlier in the day, Hezbollah fighters targeted a group of Israeli soldiers, who had moved into the al-Raheb military base, with a salvo of artillery shells.
On Friday evening, the Lebanese resistance group struck a gathering of Israeli soldiers in the al-Tayhat Triangle region with a barrage of rockets.
Hezbollah fighters also launched a rocket barrage at Israeli troops stationed in an area at Netu'a Forest and targeted an Israeli military vehicle at the Birkat Risha outpost.
Previously, the group had pounded Israeli artillery bunkers in the Khirbet Maar base and a group of Israeli troops deployed nearby with artillery shells.

title: Syrian Arrested After Shooting Near US Embassy In Beirut
message:
Lebanese army forces turn back motorists as they close a road near the US embassy in Beirut on Wednesday (AFP photo)Lebanese army forces turn back motorists as they close a road near the US embassy in Beirut on Wednesday (AFP photo)(MENAFN- Jordan Times) BEIRUT - A Syrian was arrested after a shooting near the US embassy in Beirut on Wednesday, the Lebanese said, with the embassy saying its staff were safe.
The embassy, in the northern suburb of Awkar, "was subjected to gunfire by a person holding Syrian nationality", the army said in a statement on X, formerly Twitter.
"Thanks to the quick reaction" of the Lebanese army, security forces "and our embassy security team, our facility and our team are safe", it said on X.
An AFP photographer said access to the area around the embassy was blocked off, with a heavy army deployment in the area.
A judicial source told AFP that security forces were combing wooded areas near the embassy for any accomplices, adding that the shooter's wounds were "serious".

title: Missile strikes cargo ship off Yemen : security firm
message:
LONDON, June 9, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - An Antigua and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship caught fire after it was hit by a missile off the coast of Yemen, maritime security firm Ambrey said on Saturday.
"The ship was heading southwest along the Gulf of Aden at a speed of 8.2kts when the forward station was struck by a missile.
"No injuries were reported," the security firm added.
The attack comes amid a campaign of drone and missile strikes against Israeli-linked shipping by Yemen's Iran-backed Huthi rebels.
Since January, the United States and Britain have launched retaliatory strikes on Huthi targets in Yemen in response to the attacks on shipping.

title: Five Somali soldiers and 47 Al - Shabaab militants killed north of Mogadishu
message:
ALBAWABA- The Somali government announced that five soldiers were killed in an Al-Shabaab attack approximately 350 kilometers north of Mogadishu.
The government stated that its forces received intelligence about a planned attack in the Seldir area and set up an ambush for the militants.
During the ensuing clashes in the Galgadud region, north of the capital, at least 47 Al-Shabaab militants were killed alongside the five soldiers, according to government authorities.
Local resident, Mohamed Hussein reported to AFP, "There was intense fighting in Seldir this morning after Al-Shabaab attacked from multiple directions.
On May 26, 2023, Al-Shabaab attacked a base in Bulo Marer, occupied by Ugandan soldiers from the African Union force, resulting in the deaths of at least 54 soldiers according to Ugandan authorities.

Fifty-seven Al-Shabaab militants and 5 Somali soldiers were killed in the battle.

title: This horror must stop : More than 200 killed as Israel rescues four Gaza hostages
message:
GAZA STRIP: sraelis on Sunday cheered the rescue of four hostages from war-torn Gaza while Palestinians counted the cost, with Hamas officials saying 274 people were killed and hundreds wounded during the daytime raid.
Financial newspaper Calcalist hailed a “heroic operation” that had given Israelis “a few hours of grace”, while the left-leaning Haaretz daily called the rescue operation a “morale boost” for the nation.

title: MBI investigating officer - involved shooting in Corinth
message:
MEMPHIS, Tenn. — The Mississippi Bureau of Investigation (MBI) is investigating an officer-involved shooting in Corinth, Mississippi involving the Alcorn County Sheriff’s Office that occurred on June 8.
Deputies with the Alcorn County Sheriff’s Office responded to a call for service on County Road 575 in Corinth, Mississippi at approximately 3:30 p.m.
The first deputy on the scene observed a white male striking a white female, later identified as his mother in the head with an object.
As the subject continued to strike his mother in the head the deputy then fired his service weapon striking the male subject.
Upon completing the investigation, MBI agents said they would share their findings with the Attorney General’s office.

title: Italy hard - right leader tells EU center parties their time is up as she votes in European election
message:
ROME (AP) — Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni joined voters in Italy and a half dozen European Union nations in casting a ballot during the penultimate day of European Union parliamentary elections on Saturday.
The bloc’s premier hard-right politician threw down the gauntlet to the traditional center parties, telling them their time to run the EU as they liked was up.
He attacked the European Union, suggesting he was a victim because of his views that differ sharply from the EU’s mainstream.
The result could expand Meloni’s influence in the EU, as von der Leyen has not ruled out a coalition with her group.
The main voting day is Sunday, with citizens in 20 European countries, including Germany, France and Poland, casting their ballots for the 720-seat European Parliament.

title: A World War II veteran just married his bride near Normandy D - Day beaches – NBC Bay Area
message:
But World War II veteran Harold Terens and his sweetheart Jeanne Swerlin proved that love is eternal as they tied the knot Saturday inland of the D-Day beaches in Normandy, France.
Their respective ages — he’s 100, she’s a youngster of just 96 — made their nuptials an almost double-century celebration.
On D-Day, Terens helped repair planes returning from France so they could rejoin the battle.
Terens himself went to France 12 days later, helping transport freshly captured Germans and just-freed American POWs to England.
Following the Nazi surrender in May 1945, Terens again helped transport freed Allied prisoners to England before he shipped back to the U.S. a month later.

It began after Hamas-led militants attacked Israel on Oct. 7, killing about 1,200 people and taking around 250 hostage.The Houthis have launched more than 50 attacks on shipping, killed three sailors, seized one vessel and sunk another since November, according to the US Maritime Administration.

title: 2 killed , fires rage in Lebanon after Israeli strikes - World
message:
BEIRUT: Israeli strikes on Saturday killed two people and sparked wildfires in southern Lebanon, state media said, with Hezbollah announcing the death of one fighter.
Hezbollah, a Hamas ally, has traded near-daily fire with Israeli forces in the eight months since the Gaza conflict began, triggered by Hamas’ October 7 raid.
The deadly clashes have intensified in recent weeks, causing multiple brush fires on both sides of the Israel-Lebanon border.
The movement later announced that one of its fighters was killed by Israeli fire.
More than eight months of border violence, which began on October 8, has killed 458 people in Leba­non, mostly fighters but including about 90 civilians, according to a tally.

title: 4 killed , 5 injured in Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon
message:
4 killed, 5 injured in Israeli airstrikes in LebanonBeirut: Four people, including two Hezbollah members, were killed, and five others were injured in Israeli airstrikes on villages in southern Lebanon, Lebanese military sources told the media.
The sources, who spoke anonymously, said on Saturday that an Israeli warplane targeted a house in the village of Houla, killing two Hezbollah members and injuring three civilians, Xinhua news agency reported.
The sources added that another Israeli airstrike targeted, with two air-to-surface missiles, a commercial market in the village of Aitaroun, killing two civilians and wounding two others.
Tensions increased between Hezbollah and the Israeli army in the wake of the latter’s announcement of completing deployment for a major offensive against the former.
Israel then retaliated by firing heavy artillery toward southeastern Lebanon.

message:
LONDON: Projectiles struck two cargo ships off the coast of Yemen on Saturday night without causing any casualties, maritime security agencies said.
An Antigua and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship caught fire after being hit by a missile off Yemen on Saturday night, maritime security firm Ambrey said.

“The ship was heading south-west along the Gulf of Aden at a speed of 8.2 knots when the forward station was struck by a missile.
Persons on board small boats in the vicinity opened fire on the ship during the incident.”A second incident was reported, 70 nautical miles south-west of Aden three hours after the initial strike.

title: Austin Bay : Poland Eastern Shield : On NATO Eastern Flank : Part 2
message:

event_breakdown: Poland has decided to create a wall along its border with Russia in order to have a line of defense in case of war. Russia-Ukraine war: Key events, day 835

Ukraine: Heavy shelling in Donbas

* Heavy shelling was reported in the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine on Saturday.
* The shelling targeted several villages and towns, causing damage to infrastructure and residential buildings.* Ukrainian forces accused the Russian army of carrying out the shelling.

Russia: Ukrainian forces launch missile attack on oil depot

* Ukrainian forces launched a missile attack on a Russian oil depot in the Rostov region on Saturday, Russian officials said.
* The depot, located in the Kuybyshev district, was severely damaged, according to reports.* Russian authorities condemned the attack and vowed to take retaliatory action.

Poland: Russian warplanes violate Polish airspace

* Russian warplanes violated Poland's airspace on Saturday, according to the Polish military.
* Two Russian Su-30 fighters and two Russian An-72 transport planes violated Polish airspace for around an hour, Poland's Ministry of Defense said.* The incident marks the second time Russian aircraft have violated Polish airspace in recent days.

Conclusion

The missile hit the ship’s forward station, starting a fire that those on board later put out, the private security firm Ambrey said.
A second missile fired at the ship missed and people “on board small boats in the vicinity opened fire on the ship during the incident,” Ambrey added, though no one was hurt onboard.
The Houthis did not immediately claim the assault, though it can sometimes take hours or even days for them to acknowledge their attacks.
The Houthis have launched more than 50 attacks on shipping, killed three sailors, seized one vessel and sunk another since November, according to the U.S. Maritime Administration.

title: Spain , Ireland and Norway recognize a Palestinian state
message:
Spain, Ireland and Norway said Wednesday that they would recognize a Palestinian state on May 28, a step toward a long-held Palestinian aspiration that came amid international outrage over the civilian death toll and humanitarian crisis in the Gaza Strip following Israel’s offensive.
Some 140 of 190 represented in the U.N. countries have already recognized a Palestinian state.
The 1948 U.N. decision that created Israel envisaged a neighboring Palestinian state, but some 70 years later control of the Palestinian territories remains divided and bids for U.N. membership have been denied.
The leaders of Spain, Ireland, Malta and Slovenia said in March they were considering recognizing a Palestinian state as “a positive contribution” toward ending the war.
French President Emmanuel Macron said in February it’s not “taboo” for France to recognize a Palestinian state.

title: Ukraine says hit Su - 57 fighter jet inside Russia
message:
KYIV, Ukraine, June 9, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - Ukraine said Sunday it had hit an Su-57 fighter jet parked at an airfield in southern Russia, its first ever attack on Moscow's latest generation stealth aircraft.
The flagship Su-57 entered into service with Russia's aerospace forces in December 2020 and was designed to replace ageing Soviet-designed fighter aircraft like the Su-27 and MiG-29.
"On 8 June 2024, a Su-57 multi-purpose fighter jet of the aggressor state was struck at the Akhtubinsk airfield in Russia's Astrakhan region, 589 kilometres (366 miles) from the line of contact," Ukraine's GUR military intelligence said.
It also published before-and-after satellite imagery of what it said showed fire damage and debris around an Su-57 jet parked on an airfield.
Ukraine often targets military and energy facilities on Russian territory in drone attacks, sometimes hundreds of kilometres from the front line.

title: Dublin stabbing victim named locally as young father - of - two as garda probe continues
message:
A man who died following a stabbing incident in Finglas overnight has been named as father-of-two Mark Carroll, who was 34.
An investigation is taking place after the fatal assault of Mr Carroll in the Finglas area of north Dublin in the early hours of this morning.
Emergency services attended a house in the Scribblestown area shortly after 1am, where the man was found with serious injuries.

title: The German board game that changed the face of war
message:
This aborted invasion, like many of their plans, had been workshopped using Kriegsspiel (“war game”), a battle simulator.
Planning officers were divided into two teams, controlling painted lead-block troops representing German and enemy forces.
Most German officers thought it too radical to work, and those who supported it did so largely out of desperation – the Nazis were out of moves.
A Kriegsspiel ("war game") session in progressKriegsspiel had been used by German strategists for nearly a century, but it was far older than that.

title: Israeli minister Benny Gantz resigns from war cabinet in blow to Netanyahu
message:
CNN —Israeli war cabinet member Benny Gantz has resigned from Benjamin Netanyahu’s government, delivering a blow to the prime minister who has been celebrating the rare rescue of hostages held in Gaza.
Israeli Minister Benny Gantz addresses the media after announcing his resignation from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s emergency government on June 9, 2024.
Besides the prime minister, the only other remaining member of the emergency government with decision-making power is Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, also from Likud.
Eyad Baba/AFP/Getty ImagesThe United States has repeatedly called on the prime minister to present a tangible post-war plan for Gaza.
“The more identical his positions are to those of the prime minister, the more he’ll lose on both sides.
event_breakdown:
Israeli warplanes struck Hamas positions in Gaza on Tuesday in response to a rocket attack launched from the coastal enclave late Monday, the first such attack since a cease-fire ended the latest round of fighting in May.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday evening, Israel time, launched airstrikes against what Israel said was a gathering of Hamas terrorists in Syria, near the Syrian capital Damascus.
Gantz, along with Netanyahu's Likud Party and the centrist Blue and White Party, had formed the coalition government in April after three bitter and divisive elections.
Gantz announced Monday he had reached an agreement with Netanyahu, but left the government the next day, ostensibly due to political views inside the party not lining up with those of the coalition.

title: South Korea Resumes Loudspeaker Broadcasts After North Trash Balloons
message:
(File)South Korea resumed loudspeaker broadcasts directed at North Korea on Sunday, its military said, following through on a warning demanding Pyongyang stop sending balloons carrying trash into the South.
South Korea had warned the North it would take retaliatory measures which could include propaganda broadcasts from huge loudspeakers set up at the border.
The broadcasts were made Sunday afternoon and whether more will follow depends on how North Korea responds, South Korea's military said.
South Korea's broadcasts include world news and information about democratic and capitalist society with a mix of popular K-pop music.
The sound is believed to travel more than 20 kilometres (12.4 miles) into North Korea.
location: The event takes place at the Korean Demilitarized Zone.
event_breakdown: South Korea resumed loudspeaker broadcasts directed at North Korea on Sunday, its military said, following through on a warning demanding Pyongyang stop sending balloons carrying trash into the South.

title: Helmet - cam footage : Shayetet 13 commandos escort rescued hostages to helicopters
message:
תיעוד ממצלמות הקסדה של לוחמי שייטת 13 צילום: דובר צה"לDuring Operation "Arnon" to rescue the hostages by the Israel Police ‘Yamam’ (National Counter-Terrorism Unit) and the ISA yesterday (Saturday), IDF soldiers rescued the hostages and the special forces under fire.
The Paratrooper Reconnaissance Unit Combat Team led the rescue of the hostages and the Yamam and ISA forces from the vehicles while under fire while continuing to eliminate terrorists.
The Shaldag special forces of the IAF and the Yamam directed the airstrikes and activation of fire throughout the operation.
Soldiers of Unit 669 and the Shaldag Unit protected the life of Israel Police ‘Yamam’ Squad Commander, Chief Inspector Arnon Zamora z”l, from the moment of the encounter until arriving at the hospital, where he died of his wounds.
event_breakdown:
Operation "Arnon" - Yesterday (Saturday), Israeli security forces, including the Israel Defense Forces (IDF), Israel Security Agency (ISA), and the Israel Police, carried out an operation to rescue hostages taken by terrorists. The operation took place in the Judea and Samaria region, but specific details cannot be provided for security reasons.

A news push on this event is live on the IDF's official Twitter account, @IDF, in the headline "OPERATION ARNON: IDF special forces lead operation to rescue hostages and eliminate terrorists." It took place in Israel's Judea and Samaria Region.
